title: I'm a U.S. Citizen who wants to sponsor my sister to come to U.S. What is the best and quickest way?
question: Hello, I live in U.S. since 1998 and am a U.S. Citizen, since 2000.
answers:
The current wait time for a visa number to become available for a sibling petition is likely closer to 12 years for most countries. For some countries, such as the Philippines, the wait time is closer to 23 years. You can look at the dates with Visa Bulletin. The Department of State publishes the Bulletin every month. The Bulletin is free at http://travel.state.gov/visa/frvi/bulletin/bulletin_1360.html .

Immigration laws can change at any time. A few years ago, there were discussions of eliminating the sibling petitions. Thus, after you have submitted your petition, you may find the petition invalidated. However, on the other hand, if you do not file a petition, then your turn would never come if the government does not eliminate sibling petitions.

If you have money (a lot of it), perhaps you can lend your sister the money and she can apply to immigrate to the US via an investor visa.

You should review the specific facts with your attorney to see if your sister has other options to come to the US.

The I-130 petition is the only way that you can file a petition for your sister. However, an employment based petition can also be pursued if there is a company willing to file a petition for your sister. The period for the I-130 petition would certainly take some time, and sometimes it would depend on which country you are from. Consult an immigration lawyer to discuss in detail your options.

Well, you can go ahead and file a petition for I-130 and it takes around 7 years to process. You can also look into employment based dual intent visas such as H, O, etc. Talk to a good immigration lawyer, many have been able to qualify under such visas and still keep their family petitions alive.

Good Luck
